definitions.definition: ( transitive , also figuratively , obsolete ) To make less heavy ; to lighten ; to alleviate , to relieve .

subdefinitions.definition: Often followed by from or off : to get off an animal which one has been riding ; to dismount ; to descend or exit from a vehicle ; hence, to complete one's journey ; to stop .
examples: Passengers are alighting from the carriage.

subdefinitions.definition: ( also figuratively ) Often followed by at , on , or upon : of something aloft : to descend and settle ; to land , to lodge , to rest .
examples: A flying bird alights upon a tree.

subdefinitions.definition: ( archaic ) To come down or go down ; to descend. Often followed by on or upon : of a blow , something thrown , etc.: to land heavily .
( figuratively ) Often followed by on or upon : to find by accident ; to chance upon , to come upon .

main_definition: ( transitive , also figuratively , obsolete ) To make less heavy ; to lighten ; to alleviate , to relieve .

definitions.definition: To cast light on (something); to illuminate , to light up .
To set light to (something); to set (something) on fire ; to ignite , to light .

main_definition: To cast light on (something); to illuminate , to light up .
secondary_definitions: To set light to (something); to set (something) on fire ; to ignite , to light .
